plots.summary: Persistently questions Hagrid about his journey and injuries, while also revealing his own encounter with dementors over the summer.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, a Gryffindor student concerned for Hagrid's well-being.
plots.summary: Harry worries about Hagrid's injuries and the content of his lessons, but is amused by Malfoy's discomfort.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, a Gryffindor student who can see thestrals.
plots.summary: Harry is relieved to see the thestrals, confirming he's not imagined them. He later looks forward to Christmas at the Burrow but feels guilty about leaving Sirius alone.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, leader of Dumbledore's Army, and a fifth-year Gryffindor student.
plots.summary: Harry leads the D.A. meeting, experiences his first kiss with Cho, and has a disturbing vision of Mr. Weasley being attacked.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist who had the vision of Mr. Weasley's attack.
plots.summary: Harry struggles to convince others of the reality of his vision and feels frustrated by Dumbledore's lack of direct eye contact.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, worried about Mr. Weasley and confused by Dumbledore's behavior.
plots.summary: Harry observes Dumbledore's actions with a mix of frustration and curiosity, still processing the events of his vision.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, struggling with guilt and fear about his role in Mr. Weasley's attack.
plots.summary: Harry grapples with his vision of the attack, worrying about his connection to Voldemort and feeling guilty about Mr. Weasley's injury. He seeks reassurance from Sirius but remains troubled.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, struggling with fears of being possessed by Voldemort.
plots.summary: Harry grapples with intense fear and self-doubt after overhearing that Voldemort might be possessing him. He isolates himself and contemplates the extent of his connection to Voldemort.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, who has been struggling with fears of being possessed by Voldemort.
plots.summary: Harry finds comfort and reassurance from his friends, particularly Ginny. He joins in the Christmas festivities and receives various gifts from his friends and extended family.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, a young wizard visiting his friend's father in the hospital.
plots.summary: Harry observes the interactions at the hospital, feeling sympathy for both Lockhart and Neville. He attempts to protect Neville's privacy when his situation is revealed.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, visiting St. Mungo's Hospital with his friends.
plots.summary: Harry feels sympathy for Neville and struggles with the knowledge of his parents' fate. He reluctantly shares information about Bellatrix Lestrange's involvement.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, preparing to return to Hogwarts.
plots.summary: Harry learns about Occlumency lessons, worries about Sirius, and struggles with the prospect of extra time with Snape.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, returning to Hogwarts and beginning Occlumency lessons.
plots.summary: Harry experiences a chaotic journey on the Knight Bus, asks Cho out, and begins his first Occlumency lesson with Snape, learning about his mental connection to Voldemort.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, witnessing the aftermath of his vision.
plots.summary: Harry learns about the Azkaban breakout, which likely explains his vision of Voldemort's happiness from the previous night.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, dealing with the fallout of the Azkaban breakout and increased attention.
plots.summary: Harry grapples with the news of the breakout, faces renewed attention from students, continues leading Dumbledore's Army, and struggles with Occlumency lessons.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, struggling with his connection to Voldemort and navigating his first date.
plots.summary: Harry experiences increased sensitivity to Voldemort's moods, goes on an awkward date with Cho, and deals with the emotional fallout of their misunderstanding.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, a young wizard facing challenges and public disbelief.
plots.summary: Harry meets with Hagrid and later agrees to be interviewed about Voldemort's return, showing determination to spread the truth despite public skepticism.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, a fifth-year Gryffindor student at Hogwarts.
plots.summary: Harry gives a controversial interview about Voldemort's return, gaining support and facing consequences from Umbridge.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, a young wizard struggling with his connection to Voldemort.
plots.summary: Harry experiences a vision of Voldemort, shares it with his friends, and struggles with Occlumency lessons under Snape's tutelage.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, a fifth-year student at Hogwarts leading the secret D.A. group.
plots.summary: Harry leads the D.A., is warned by Dobby, attempts to escape, but is caught and brought to Dumbledore's office. He tries to deny knowledge of the group.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, a fifth-year student caught in a difficult situation.
plots.summary: Harry witnesses Dumbledore's selfless act and escape, feeling guilty for causing trouble and concerned about the headmaster's departure.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, now at the center of attention after witnessing Dumbledore's departure.
plots.summary: Harry deals with the aftermath of Dumbledore's escape, facing constant questions and attention from other students.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, a Gryffindor student often at odds with authority.
plots.summary: Harry is interrogated by Umbridge, witnesses the fireworks spectacle, and has another dream about the Department of Mysteries.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, a young wizard struggling with Occlumency lessons and curiosity about his parents' past.
plots.summary: Harry enters Snape's Pensieve without permission, observing a memory of his father and his friends during their O.W.L. exams.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, observing his parents' past through Snape's memory.
plots.summary: Harry is deeply disturbed by what he sees, struggling to reconcile the image of his father as a bully with his previous idealized view.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, dealing with the emotional aftermath of Snape's memory.
plots.summary: Harry is depressed and conflicted about his father's past, avoiding his friends' concerns and longing to talk to Sirius.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, a fifth-year student at Hogwarts, considering his future career.
plots.summary: Harry expresses interest in becoming an Auror, plans to contact Sirius secretly, and faces opposition from Umbridge during his career advice session.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, a fifth-year student at Hogwarts.
plots.summary: Harry struggles with recurring dreams about the Department of Mysteries, avoids resuming Occlumency lessons, and follows Hagrid into the Forbidden Forest despite his reservations.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, a fifth-year student at Hogwarts.
plots.summary: Harry follows Hagrid into the forest and reluctantly agrees to help with Grawp, feeling bound by his promise to Hagrid despite the obvious dangers and impracticality of the situation.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, a fifth-year student at Hogwarts.
plots.summary: Harry is preoccupied with the upcoming O.W.L. exams and struggles to find a way to tell Ron about Grawp. He's relieved that Snape is no longer giving him Occlumency lessons.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, a fifth-year student at Hogwarts taking his O.W.L. exams.
plots.summary: Harry navigates through various exams, showing strength in Defense Against the Dark Arts but struggling in subjects like Divination. He remains determined to perform well, especially to not let Hagrid down in Care of Magical Creatures.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, a fifth-year student at Hogwarts taking his O.W.L. exams.
plots.summary: Harry attempts to complete his History of Magic exam but is distracted and exhausted. He experiences a vivid vision of Voldemort torturing Sirius in the Department of Mysteries.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, a fifth-year student at Hogwarts taking his O.W.L. exams.
plots.summary: Harry experiences the end of his vision about Voldemort torturing Sirius and wakes up in distress during his exam, his scar burning.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, determined to save Sirius after his vision.
plots.summary: Harry insists on acting on his vision, refusing to go to the hospital wing and frantically trying to find a way to contact Sirius.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, desperately trying to contact Sirius.
plots.summary: Harry attempts to use Umbridge's fireplace to contact Sirius, gets caught, and faces intense interrogation from Umbridge.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, following Hermione's lead into the Forbidden Forest.
plots.summary: Harry follows Hermione's plan, uncertain of her intentions but trusting her judgment. He attempts to protect her from the centaurs.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, trying to save Sirius Black from Voldemort.
plots.summary: Harry struggles with the urgent need to rescue Sirius and the responsibility of keeping his friends safe. He reluctantly accepts their help and leadership role in the mission.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, leading the rescue mission for Sirius.
plots.summary: Harry takes charge of the group, guiding them to the Ministry and into the Department of Mysteries, driven by his concern for Sirius.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, leading the group through the Department of Mysteries.
plots.summary: Harry guides his friends through various rooms, driven by his determination to find Sirius. He becomes intrigued by the veiled archway and ultimately discovers a glass orb with his name on it.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The main protagonist, holder of the prophecy, and target of the Death Eaters.
plots.summary: Harry attempts to protect his friends and the prophecy while trying to understand its significance. He uses quick thinking and bravery to lead his friends in the fight against the Death Eaters.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, a young wizard trying to protect his friends and the prophecy.
plots.summary: Harry leads the group, makes quick decisions under pressure, and attempts to negotiate with the Death Eaters to save his friends.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, a young wizard fighting against Death Eaters to protect the prophecy.
plots.summary: Harry struggles to protect his friends and the prophecy. He witnesses Sirius's death and is overcome with grief and rage, pursuing Bellatrix for revenge.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, devastated by the loss of his godfather Sirius.
plots.summary: Harry is in denial about Sirius's death and fights against Lupin's attempts to stop him. He then pursues Bellatrix, seeking revenge for Sirius's death.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, a young wizard fighting against Voldemort and his Death Eaters.
plots.summary: Harry duels with Bellatrix, experiences intense pain and possession by Voldemort, and is ultimately saved by Dumbledore.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, dealing with the aftermath of the battle at the Ministry.
plots.summary: Harry is consumed by grief and guilt over Sirius's death, struggling to process recent events.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, struggling with grief and anger over Sirius's death.
plots.summary: Harry experiences intense emotions, questioning Dumbledore's decisions and expressing his anger. He gradually comes to understand the complex circumstances surrounding recent events.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, recently involved in a battle at the Ministry of Magic.
plots.summary: Harry visits his friends in the hospital wing, struggles with the weight of the prophecy, and later confronts Malfoy in the entrance hall.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, a young wizard struggling with the loss of his godfather and the weight of his destiny.
plots.summary: Harry grapples with grief and isolation, seeking ways to communicate with Sirius and understand death. He experiences conflicting emotions about his newfound recognition and the burden of his fate.

plots.name: Harry Potter
plots.description: The protagonist, a 15-year-old wizard who has just lost his godfather Sirius Black.
plots.summary: Harry is grieving Sirius's death and feeling isolated. He finds some comfort in talking with Luna and the support of his friends. He leaves for summer break with mixed emotions.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm so frustrated being cut off from the wizarding world. I need to hear any news about Voldemort or unusual events. The Dursleys are clueless about the danger we're in. I'm worried about my friends and what's happening at Hogwarts. I feel isolated and anxious, but I must stay hidden to avoid the Dursleys' wrath.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm apprehensive about this lesson. While I'm generally good at practical magic, precise charms like this can be tricky. I'm curious to see how well I'll do compared to the others. I'm also worried about Ron; he tends to struggle with new spells. At least we can count on Hermione to help us if we need it later.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: Frustration and anger simmer within me as I struggle to resist Snape's mental attacks. I'm exhausted and feel like I'm making no progress. The constant criticism only fuels my resentment. I want to prove I'm not weak, but it's so difficult to control my emotions. There's something nagging at the back of my mind about my recurring dreams, but I can't quite grasp it yet.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm drowning in a sea of grief, guilt, and fury. How could this have happened? It's all my fault. I can't bear to face Dumbledore or anyone else. I want to scream, to run, to make this pain stop. Why didn't anyone tell me the truth? I need answers, but I'm too angry to ask.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: Frustrated and isolated, I'm desperate for any news about Voldemort's return. The unexpected noise has me on edge – could it be connected to the magical world? I need to stay alert but can't risk using magic. Uncle Vernon's reaction is predictable, but I must control my temper and not reveal anything suspicious.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm fed up with Dudley's constant bullying and my forced isolation from my friends. I want to show Dudley I'm not his punching bag anymore. Maybe if I taunt him about his fear of the dark, he'll back off. I'm also worried about what's happening in the wizarding world and frustrated by the lack of news. I need to be careful not to use magic, but I won't let Dudley push me around.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm overwhelmed and confused. The dementor attack was terrifying, and now Mrs. Figg knows about magic? I need answers, but first, I have to get Dudley home safely. I'm worried about the consequences of using magic outside school and frustrated by the lack of information from my friends all summer.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm overwhelmed with worry about my future at Hogwarts and frustration at the Dursleys' lack of understanding. I need to stay calm and explain the dementor attack, but I'm anxious about the Ministry's letters. I must defend myself while protecting Dudley and navigating this precarious situation with my relatives.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: Overwhelmed by recent events, Harry feels a mix of fear, frustration, and anger. He's desperately trying to make the Dursleys understand the seriousness of the dementor attack and its consequences. Worried about his potential expulsion from Hogwarts, he's also irritated by his relatives' ignorance and hostility towards the magical world.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: Anger and confusion swirl in Harry's mind. He feels betrayed by his friends' silence and adults' secrecy. Determined to get answers, he's ready to demand information about the attack, his potential expulsion, and when he can leave Privet Drive. He's worried about his future at Hogwarts and frustrated by his isolation from the wizarding world. Harry hopes his letters will prompt immediate action and support from his friends and godfather.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm on edge, torn between relief at seeing familiar faces and fear of a potential trap. After the events of the Triwizard Tournament and Voldemort's return, I can't be too careful. I'm desperate for information about my hearing and the wizarding world, but I need to stay alert and ready to defend myself if necessary.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm finally leaving Privet Drive! But this seems more dangerous than I expected. Can I keep up with experienced flyers? What if something goes wrong? I'm excited but scared. I need to focus and follow their instructions carefully. This is real - Voldemort is back, and these people are risking their lives for me.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: Overwhelmed by the strange surroundings and burning with questions, Harry feels a mix of relief and frustration. He's eager to see his friends but annoyed by the secrecy that's kept him in the dark all summer. He's determined to get answers about the Order and recent events.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: Conflicted between anger at being left out and relief at finally being with his friends. Desperate for information about Voldemort and the Order. Feeling betrayed but also curious. Wants to understand why he was kept isolated all summer.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: Relieved to finally be with people who understand his situation, Harry is desperate for information about Voldemort and the Order. He's frustrated by the secrecy and feels a mix of anger and concern for his friends. Seeing Sirius's apparent unhappiness, Harry is worried and curious about what's been happening.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: Frustration and curiosity battle within me. After weeks of isolation, I'm desperate for information about Voldemort's activities. I feel I've earned the right to know what's happening, given what I've been through. I'm determined to assert myself and gain some answers, even if it means challenging the adults around me.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm bursting with questions and anger. The Ministry's denial is infuriating, and I need to understand why they're acting this way. I witnessed Voldemort's return myself, so why won't they believe us? I feel isolated and frustrated, desperate for information and a way to contribute to the fight. I trust these adults, but I sense they're holding back.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm fascinated by Sirius's family home and eager to learn more about my godfather's past. However, I'm also frustrated by being kept in the dark about Order business and worried about my upcoming disciplinary hearing. The cleaning task seems tedious, but it might provide an opportunity to overhear something important. I'm torn between curiosity about the house and anxiety about recent events.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: Curious about the twins' progress with their joke shop and proud to have helped them. Impressed by their inventiveness but concerned about the safety of their testing methods. Aware of the need for secrecy around Mrs. Weasley and trying to appear casual while discussing their plans. Interested in learning more about their products and business strategy while helping with the cleaning.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: Overwhelmed with anxiety about the hearing, Harry's mind races with worst-case scenarios. He fears expulsion from Hogwarts and returning to the Dursleys permanently. Despite the support around him, he feels isolated by the weight of his predicament. Harry wants reassurance but struggles to articulate his concerns.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm fascinated by this glimpse into wizard family histories, but also wary of upsetting Sirius. I'm curious about these connections, especially to families I know. At the same time, I'm anxious about my upcoming hearing and grateful for this distraction. I want to understand Sirius better and show him I care.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm overwhelmed by the grandeur of the Ministry and anxious about my hearing. Everything seems so official and intimidating. I'm grateful for Mr. Weasley's guidance but worried about what lies ahead. I hope I can defend myself properly and avoid expulsion from Hogwarts.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: Overwhelmed and anxious, Harry struggles to maintain composure. He's frustrated by the court's unwillingness to hear his side and fears for his future at Hogwarts. Determined to explain about the dementors, he's caught between respecting authority and defending himself against what he sees as an unjust accusation.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I feel so out of place and powerless in this intimidating courtroom. Dumbledore's presence is reassuring, but why won't he look at me? I hope his arguments are enough to convince them of my innocence. I'm worried about what Fudge might say next. Should I speak up if they twist the facts about my past?

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: Relieved about the hearing's outcome but wary of Malfoy's presence. Suspicious of Malfoy's motives and concerned about his influence on Fudge. Feeling protective of Mr. Weasley and wanting to stand up to Malfoy's intimidation. Curious about the reason for Malfoy's presence at the Ministry.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm anxious about returning to Hogwarts after the events of last year. Being made prefect would be a nice validation, but I'm also worried about Sirius being left alone. I hope there's good news in these letters to lift everyone's spirits.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: Feeling conflicted - happy for Ron but disappointed and confused about not being chosen himself. Wondering about Dumbledore's decision and trying to mask his hurt. Wants to be supportive of his friends despite his inner turmoil.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: Feeling a bit out of place without Ron and Hermione. Curious about Neville's plant but wary of magical surprises. Slightly anxious about the upcoming school year and the challenges it might bring. Wants to make a good impression on his peers, especially after the events of last term.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm curious about the prefect news, but I can't help feeling a bit left out and jealous. Why wasn't I chosen? I try to be happy for Ron and Hermione, but it's hard. I'm also dreading the potential confrontation with Malfoy, especially after the events of last year.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm feeling anxious and confused. These horse-like creatures weren't here before - why can I see them now? And where's Hagrid? Everything feels off, and I can't shake this sense of unease. I need to find out what's going on, but I don't want to worry Ron and Hermione more than necessary.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: Exhausted and frustrated, Harry feels a surge of anger at being doubted yet again. He's determined to defend his truth about Voldemort's return, even if it means alienating his classmates. The weight of recent events and the looming threat of the Ministry's interference at Hogwarts add to his irritation.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: Feeling frustrated by the skepticism he's facing, Harry tries to focus on the upcoming year. He's worried about the increased workload and new challenges, especially with the tension from classmates like Seamus. He wants to discuss these concerns with his friends and seek their support.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: Feeling overwhelmed by the upcoming year and frustrated with his friends' constant bickering. Anxious about facing Snape in Potions and curious about the new Defense Against the Dark Arts teacher. Struggling with the weight of recent events and the skepticism he faces about Voldemort's return.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: Frustrated and angry, Harry is determined to challenge Umbridge's curriculum. He's haunted by his recent encounter with Voldemort and feels an urgent need for practical defense training. Harry's ready to speak out, driven by a sense of responsibility to warn his classmates about the real danger they face.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: Overwhelmed and frustrated, Harry feels like he's under constant scrutiny. He's struggling to understand why people doubt him and Dumbledore about Voldemort's return. The weight of being "The Boy Who Lived" feels heavier than ever as he grapples with the isolation caused by others' disbelief. He's desperate for support and validation.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm deeply worried about Hagrid's unexplained absence and frustrated by the continued disbelief in Voldemort's return. The pressure of O.W.L.s and Umbridge's tyranny are overwhelming. I'm determined to find out what's happened to Hagrid, even if it means confronting Malfoy. I need answers and support from my friends.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm dreading this detention, but I need to ask about rescheduling for Quidditch tryouts. Umbridge probably won't agree, but I have to try. I'm stressed about homework piling up and don't want to miss practice. I'll stay polite and control my temper, no matter what she says or does.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm exhausted and my hand is killing me. I can't believe Umbridge is getting away with this torture. Why is Ron out so late with his broom? He's been acting strange lately. I hope everything's okay with him. I don't want to worry him with my problems, but I wish I could tell someone about these detentions.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm torn between joy for Ron's success and the worry gnawing at me after Umbridge's detention. My hand throbs, and the pain in my scar concerns me deeply. I want to confide in my friends, but I'm hesitant to dampen Ron's moment or burden them with my troubles. Should I tell Dumbledore? He seems so distant lately.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I need to get this letter to Sirius without anyone finding out. I'm worried about my scar hurting and what's happening with Umbridge. I hope I can avoid any trouble on the way to the Owlery. Maybe I should have waited for Ron and Hermione to wake up, but this feels urgent. I just want someone to talk to about all this.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm worried someone might have overheard me talking to Hedwig about Sirius. I need to be more careful. With all the stress from Umbridge and the upcoming Quidditch practices, I can't afford any more trouble. I hope whoever just came in didn't notice anything suspicious.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm exhausted and worried about Ron's Quidditch performance. This letter from Percy is unexpected and concerning. I hope it doesn't cause more problems for Ron or our friendship. I'm also anxious about my own reputation and the challenges we're facing at Hogwarts.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm deeply worried about my scar hurting and its connection to Voldemort. Umbridge's presence at Hogwarts is frustrating and I suspect she might be involved with dark forces. I'm eager for information from Sirius but also concerned for his safety. I want to understand what's happening with the Order and the Ministry's actions.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm already on edge with Umbridge here, and now this. What's the Ministry up to? I can't shake the feeling that things are about to get worse. My hand still stings from her punishment, and I'm worried about what more power could mean for me and my friends. I need to stay alert and figure out what this means for Dumbledore and Hogwarts.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm conflicted watching this unfold. While I despise Umbridge and her methods, I also know Trelawney's predictions are usually rubbish. Still, seeing a teacher humiliated like this makes me uncomfortable and angry. I need to stay alert and not draw attention to myself.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm conflicted about teaching Defense Against the Dark Arts. While I want to help my fellow students, I'm worried about seeming arrogant or drawing unwanted attention. The idea of organizing a secret group is both exciting and nerve-wracking. I'm also concerned about Sirius's safety and the possibility of him showing up in Hogsmeade.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm incredibly uncomfortable with this situation. I don't want to relive my traumatic experiences or be in the spotlight, but I understand the importance of proper defense training. I'm conflicted between my desire to help and my reluctance to lead. I'm prepared to defend myself against skepticism but hope it doesn't come to that.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: Seething with anger at Umbridge's obvious attempt to thwart their plans. Determined to continue the defense group despite the risks. Worried about a potential leak but resolute in his decision to defy the decree. Concerned about the impact on his fellow students and the Quidditch team.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: This inspection is making me uncomfortable. I dislike both Umbridge and Snape, but watching them interact is fascinating. I'm worried Umbridge might make Snape even harsher towards us students. I need to focus on my potion and avoid drawing attention to myself, especially from Snape.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm seething with anger at Umbridge's intrusion into my privacy. The thought of her reading my mail makes my blood boil. I'm worried sick about Sirius - that was too close a call. We need to be more careful, but how? I want to discuss this with Ron and Hermione, but I also need to focus on this damn Silencing Charm. Umbridge won't catch me slacking in class.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: Relief washes over me about the Quidditch team's reformation, a bright spot in these dark times. Yet, Hermione's sudden doubts about our defense group unsettle me. We desperately need this training to face the dangers ahead. I'm torn between excitement for Quidditch and anxiety about our secret plans.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm thrilled about this Room of Requirement, but I can't rush into this. We need a solid plan to keep our group secret from Umbridge. I want to teach my friends properly, to prepare them for what's coming. Dobby's help is invaluable, but I need to ensure everyone's safety.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm worried about Ron's state of mind. As team captain and his best friend, I need to boost his confidence before the match. I'm determined to lead Gryffindor to victory, but Ron's performance is crucial. I must find a way to calm his nerves and remind him of his potential, all while managing my own pre-match jitters.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm frustrated and defensive. Malfoy's insults about my mother crossed a line, but I know fighting was wrong. I hope Professor McGonagall understands our reasons, even if she has to punish us. I'm worried about the consequences, especially with Umbridge here.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm seething with anger at Umbridge's unfair ban. How could she do this? Quidditch was my one escape, and now it's gone. I feel helpless and frustrated, wanting to lash out but knowing it would only make things worse. I need to find a way to fight back against her tyranny, but right now, I just feel lost.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm relieved to see Hagrid back, but his injuries are shocking. I'm burning with curiosity about his mission and worried about what he's been through. I need to understand what happened and how it relates to Voldemort's return. I also want to tell Hagrid about my own encounter with the dementors.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: Harry is torn between loyalty to Hagrid and genuine concern for the class's safety. He's worried about Umbridge's potential reaction to Hagrid's lesson and fears for Hagrid's job security. Despite this, Harry finds some amusement in Malfoy's discomfort, given their recent Quidditch rivalry.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: Worried for Hagrid's position at Hogwarts. Angry at Umbridge's presence and her obvious bias. Curious about the thestrals and relieved to confirm he's not imagined them before. Wants to support Hagrid but unsure how to do so without making the situation worse. Tense and ready to defend his friend if necessary.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm feeling a mix of pride from the successful D.A. meeting and nervousness about being alone with Cho. I'm worried about how to handle her emotions, especially regarding Cedric. I want to comfort her, but I'm unsure how. I'm also excited and confused about my growing feelings for her.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: Overwhelmed with anxiety and frustration, Harry is desperate to convince Dumbledore of the urgency of his vision. He's confused and hurt by Dumbledore's lack of eye contact, interpreting it as disbelief or dismissal. Harry's primary concern is getting immediate help for Mr. Weasley, overshadowing his own discomfort about the vision's vivid nature.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm overwhelmed with worry for Mr. Weasley and confusion about my vision. Dumbledore's actions seem strange and indirect – why isn't he rushing to help? I feel frustrated by his apparent lack of urgency and his continued avoidance of me. I want answers about what's happening to me and how I can help Mr. Weasley.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm overwhelmed with guilt and fear. The vision of Mr. Weasley's attack haunts me, and I'm terrified of my possible connection to Voldemort. I want to confide in Sirius, but I'm scared of how everyone will react if they know the full truth. I need to find a way to explain without revealing I felt like I was the snake.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I feel contaminated, like Voldemort's inside me. What if I'm the weapon he's after? I can't let anyone know - I might put them all in danger. I need to be alone to figure this out. Every glance from the others feels like an accusation. I'm terrified of what I might do next.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: Overwhelmed with fear and guilt, Harry is convinced he's a danger to everyone around him. He's struggling with the idea of being possessed by Voldemort and feels isolated. Harry wants to protect his friends by pushing them away, but deep down, he's desperate for reassurance and understanding.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm surprised to see Neville here. There's clearly something serious going on, and I feel a mix of curiosity and concern. I want to be supportive but also respect Neville's privacy. This situation feels delicate, and I need to tread carefully to avoid causing any more discomfort.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: Burdened by the secret he's kept, Harry feels a mix of guilt and responsibility. He's torn between honoring Dumbledore's trust and his desire to explain the full truth to his friends. The weight of knowing about Neville's parents' fate and Bellatrix Lestrange's involvement weighs heavily on him. He's concerned about how this revelation will affect their relationship with Neville and their understanding of the war they're facing.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm anxious about returning to Hogwarts and leaving Sirius behind. Snape's sudden appearance is unsettling. I'm curious about Dumbledore's message but dreading any extra interaction with Snape. I need to stay calm and protect Sirius from doing anything rash.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm nervous and confused about why I need these lessons. Snape makes me uncomfortable, but I know this is important to Dumbledore. I'm still excited about my date with Cho, but I need to focus now. I hope I can learn this skill without letting Snape get to me. I'm determined to understand what's happening with my connection to Voldemort.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm still unsettled by last night's vision of Voldemort's happiness. Something significant must have happened. I'm anxious to find out what it could be and how it might impact our fight against him. I need to be ready for whatever comes next.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: Frustration and anger simmer within me. The Ministry's lies about Sirius and their denial of Voldemort's return are infuriating. I'm worried about the escaped Death Eaters and the danger they pose. I feel a mix of determination to prepare for what's coming and concern for my friends' safety. I want to discuss our next steps and how to handle this situation.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm incredibly nervous and out of my depth on this date. I want to connect with Cho, but I'm unsure how to navigate her emotions or discuss Cedric's death. I'm also anxious about my upcoming meeting with Hermione and how to explain it to Cho without causing misunderstandings. I feel pressured to make this work but completely unprepared for the emotional complexities involved.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm deeply worried about Hagrid's condition and strange behavior. His injuries look serious, and his mood is off. I want to help but feel hesitant to pry. There's so much going on with Voldemort's return that I can't share, and I wonder if Hagrid is hiding something too. I feel a mix of concern, curiosity, and frustration.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm stunned by this sudden influx of mail. Part of me is relieved that people might finally believe the truth about Voldemort, but I'm also anxious about the attention and potential backlash. I hope this helps raise awareness, but I'm wary of Umbridge's reaction. I need to stay calm and composed while figuring out what all these letters mean.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm overwhelmed and confused by the vision I've just had. My scar is burning, and I'm trying to piece together what I saw and heard. I'm worried about the implications of this information about the weapon and the Death Eaters. I feel frustrated that I can't control these visions and anxious about what Dumbledore and the others would say if they knew.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm worn out and on edge. These lessons are torture, and Snape's hostility isn't helping. I don't want him prying into my mind or discovering my recent vision. I need to find a way to block him out, but it seems impossible. Maybe if I deflect or lie, I can avoid his scrutiny.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: Caught and cornered, I'm terrified but determined to protect the D.A. Dumbledore's subtle signals suggest I should deny everything. Can I convincingly lie to the Minister? I must stay calm, think quickly, and not betray my friends or the cause we believe in.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm overwhelmed with guilt and anxiety. Dumbledore is sacrificing himself to protect me and my friends. I want to confess and take responsibility, but I also trust Dumbledore's judgment. I'm torn between speaking up and staying quiet, fearing the consequences of either action.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: Guilt weighs heavily on me for Dumbledore's departure. I'm anxious about Umbridge's newfound power and worried for Hogwarts' future. Everyone's looking to me for answers, but I'm just as lost. I need to find a way to continue what Dumbledore started and resist Umbridge's control.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I need to be extremely careful with Umbridge. She's dangerous and clearly fishing for information about Dumbledore and Sirius. I can't let anything slip, no matter what she says or does. Her niceness is obviously fake, and I'm sure she's up to something. I'll have to stay calm and deny everything, even if she threatens me. I hope I can get through this without revealing anything important.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm both excited and anxious to witness this moment from my parents' past. I hope to learn more about them, especially my father, but I'm also worried about what I might discover. I feel guilty for invading Snape's privacy, yet my curiosity overwhelms me.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm torn between guilt over invading Snape's privacy and disgust at my father's actions. I can't face Snape again, but I can't tell Ron and Hermione why. I wish I could talk to Sirius about this. I need to deflect their questions without arousing suspicion.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: Anxious yet determined to express his desire to become an Auror. Wary of Umbridge's presence and its potential impact on the conversation. Hopeful for Professor McGonagall's support but uncertain about his qualifications. Struggling to maintain focus amidst the underlying tension in the room.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm conflicted about revealing my role in Fred and George's joke shop. I'm proud of helping them but worry about Ron and Hermione's reactions. I'm also anxious about my recurring dreams and want to avoid discussions about Occlumency or Sirius. The chaos at Hogwarts is a welcome distraction from my personal troubles.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm apprehensive about what Hagrid's going to show us. His idea of 'safe' creatures is often far from it. I'm worried for Hagrid's job security and want to help, but I'm also concerned about what he might ask of us. I'm torn between loyalty to Hagrid and the potential danger of the situation.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm torn between happiness for Ron's Quidditch success and anxiety about Grawp. We need to tell Ron about Hagrid's request, but I'm dreading his reaction. Plus, the upcoming O.W.L.s are adding to my stress. At least I don't have Occlumency lessons with Snape anymore.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: Cautiously optimistic about his performance, Harry is caught between supporting Hermione's need to analyze and agreeing with Ron's desire to relax. He's curious about how others fared and slightly anxious about the upcoming exams. Harry wants to find a balance between necessary preparation and much-needed rest.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: Overwhelmed by fatigue and stress, Harry battles to concentrate on his exam. His mind feels foggy, and he's plagued by a sense of unease. As his focus wavers, he becomes increasingly susceptible to the intrusive vision, torn between his immediate surroundings and the powerful pull of the connection with Voldemort.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: Trapped in a horrifying vision, Harry is desperate to help Sirius. He's torn between the exam reality and the vivid scene of torture. Panic, fear, and a sense of helplessness overwhelm him. His scar burns intensely, adding to his distress. He wants to scream, to act, to save Sirius somehow.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: Overwhelmed with fear and frustration, Harry is desperate to save Sirius. He's battling internal conflict between his trust in his vision and his friends' doubts. Memories of past prophecies and visions fuel his urgency. He's prepared to act alone if necessary, feeling the weight of potential loss acutely.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: Panicked and defiant, Harry is desperate to protect Sirius and the Order. He's torn between maintaining secrecy and his urgent need to check on Sirius's safety. Feeling cornered and helpless, he's searching for any way out of this situation, while also worried about his friends' safety.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm completely in the dark about Hermione's plan, but I trust her. We're in serious danger without our wands. I'm furious at Umbridge for insulting Hagrid and threatening us, but I need to keep my cool and play along. I hope we find help soon before things get worse.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm overwhelmed with fear for Sirius and frustration at our situation. I need to get to London immediately, but I'm torn about risking my friends' lives. I'm grateful for their help but worried about their safety. I must find a way to reach Sirius quickly.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: Overwhelmed with worry for Sirius, Harry's mind races with determination and fear. He feels the weight of leadership, guiding his friends into potential danger. His heart pounds with urgency, knowing every second counts. He's focused on reaching the Department of Mysteries, driven by his connection to Sirius and the cryptic visions he's been experiencing.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: Intense determination to find Sirius mingles with anxiety and a sense of responsibility for his friends' safety. He's trying to recall details from his dreams to guide them, while battling inner doubts about the mission's wisdom. Harry feels the weight of leadership but is resolved to push forward at any cost.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: Anxiety and determination war within Harry as he grapples with the weight of the prophecy in his hand. He's desperate to find Sirius, whom he believes is in danger. Harry's mind races, searching for a way to protect his friends and uncover the truth about the prophecy. He's resolved to stand his ground, despite the fear gnawing at him.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: My friends are hurt and in danger. I need to protect them and this prophecy, but I don't even know why it's so important. Maybe if I keep the Death Eaters talking, I can buy us some time and figure out what's really going on. I have to stay calm and think quickly - there must be a way out of this.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm trapped and desperate to protect both the prophecy and Neville. The weight of responsibility is crushing. I'm searching for any way out, acutely aware of the danger to my friends. The grief of recent losses mingles with determination to not let their sacrifices be in vain. I must find a way to outsmart these Death Eaters.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: My mind refuses to accept what I've just witnessed. Sirius can't be gone. He's just behind that veil, waiting for me to rescue him. I need to get to him, to pull him back. Why is Lupin stopping me? I have to save Sirius, he's all the family I have left. I can't lose him, not now, not like this. I'll do anything to bring him back.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: Consumed by grief and fury over Sirius's death, I'm determined to make Bellatrix pay. My wand trembles with the force of my emotions, but I struggle to maintain focus. I want justice, but I'm out of my depth facing such a skilled dark witch. Fear and doubt gnaw at me, yet I refuse to back down.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: Overwhelmed by grief and guilt, I'm drowning in the aftermath of the Ministry battle. Sirius's death weighs heavily on my conscience. I'm desperate to escape this suffocating office and the reality it represents. I can't face questions or sympathy; I just need to be alone with my pain.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: Overwhelmed by grief and anger, I'm struggling to process Sirius's death. I'm confused about recent events and frustrated with Dumbledore for keeping secrets. I want answers and someone to blame, but I'm also afraid of what I might learn. My emotions are raw and conflicted.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm exhausted from recent events and visiting my injured friends. The prophecy weighs heavily on me, but I can't let anyone see that. Malfoy looks ready for a fight, and I'm in no mood for his antics. I need to stand my ground without escalating things too far. Maybe I can use his fear of Voldemort against him.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: Overwhelmed by grief and anger, I'm itching for a fight. Malfoy's taunts about Sirius have pushed me to the edge. I know I shouldn't use magic, but I'm past caring about rules. I'm sick of Snape's constant persecution and just want to lash out at someone, anyone.

conversations.name: Harry Potter
conversations.thought: I'm overwhelmed with grief and anger over Sirius's death. The thought of joining the feast makes me feel sick. I just want to be alone, but seeing Luna here is unexpected. Maybe talking to someone who understands loss could help, even if it's 'Loony' Lovegood.

utterances.message: [They're so delusional about Dudley. If only they knew what he really gets up to.] (represses a snort)
[Please let there be some news about the wizarding world. Anything at all...] (listens intently)
[That was impressive, but not surprising coming from Hermione.] (He glances at Ron, wondering how his friend will fare)
[Poor Ron, he always gets nervous during practical exams.] (He gives Ron a sympathetic look)
[I'm trying my best, but it's so hard!] I — am — making — an — effort.
[How can I not feel angry with him constantly berating me?] Yeah? Well, I'm finding that hard at the moment.
[I am not weak!] I am not weak.
[Suddenly, I recognize that corridor!] I KNOW! I KNOW!
[I've finally understood something important.] I saw — I remembered. I've just realized...
[I need to know more about this.] What's in the Department of Mysteries?
[His reaction confirms it's important.] I said, what's in the Department of Mysteries, sir?
[His words only remind me of the damage I've caused.] (tries to speak but no sound comes out)
[I can't look at him. I feel so guilty.] (nods at the carpet)
[How dare he claim to understand?] (suddenly angry) No, you don't.
[I can't bear this. I need to get away.] (turns his back on Dumbledore and stares out the window)
[His words only fuel my anger.] My greatest strength, is it? (voice shaking) You haven't got a clue... You don't know...
[I can't let him see my wand, but I need to defend myself!] (gasping and struggling) Get — off — me!
[That was close. I need to be more careful.] (trying to look innocent)
[Stay calm, don't give anything away.] (coldly) What do I mean by what?
[He thinks I made that noise? I need to convince him otherwise.] I didn't make that noise.
[I might as well tell them the truth, they won't believe me anyway.] Listening to the news.
[I can't help but be sarcastic.] Well, it changes every day, you see.
[I'll catch him off guard with this.] Not this brave at night, are you?
[What is he on about?] (confusion) What d'you mean, I'm not brave in bed? What — am I supposed to be frightened of pillows or something?
[Oh no, he couldn't have heard...] (feeling a cold sensation in his stomach) What d'you mean?
[I can't let him know the truth.] I — you're lying —
[I can't take this anymore.] (quietly) Shut up. Shut up, Dudley, I'm warning you!
[I'm losing control.] (snarling, pointing his wand) Don't ever talk about that again. D'you understand me?
[I need to stay calm and handle this carefully.] (approaching cautiously) Yes, Uncle Vernon?
[They won't believe me, but I have to try.] Nothing. I didn't do anything to him, it wasn't me, it was—
[Oh no, this can't be good.] (opening the letter with shaking hands) [reading silently] I've been expelled from Hogwarts...
[They're not listening to me at all.] (sharply) I didn't! I didn't do anything to him, it wasn't me, it was—
[They're so clueless about our world. I need to explain this simply.] I've got to go to a hearing.
[I wish I knew more myself.] I suppose so.
[I need to get out of here and process everything.] Well, if that's all... (starts to stand up)
[Great, what now?] (sighs impatiently) What now?

[I'm losing my patience with their ignorance.] (yells, with sparks shooting from his wand) FINE! Dudley and I were in the alleyway between Magnolia Crescent and Wisteria Walk. Dudley thought he'd be smart with me, I pulled out my wand but didn't use it. Then two dementors turned up —
[How many times do I have to explain this?] I told you — they suck all the happiness out of you, and if they get the chance, they kiss you —
[I can't believe I have to spell this out.] It's what they call it when they suck the soul out of your mouth.
[Their ignorance is exhausting.] (exasperated) Of course they didn't get his soul, you'd know if they had.
[I can't believe I'm stuck here with no information.] (paces the room, muttering to himself) Why is everyone treating me like a child? I've faced Voldemort, for Merlin's sake!
[That Howler to Aunt Petunia was bizarre.] (frowns) What did it mean, 'Remember my last'? And why is Aunt Petunia in touch with wizards?

[I need to write to someone who can give me answers.] (sits at his desk and begins writing) I've just been attacked by dementors and I might be expelled from Hogwarts. I want to know what's going on and when I'm going to get out of here.
[Sirius will know what to do.] (addresses the first letter) To Sirius... He'll understand how serious this is.
[Ron might have insider information from his dad.] (addresses the second letter) To Ron... Maybe Mr. Weasley has told them something.
[Hermione always knows more than she lets on.] (addresses the third letter) To Hermione... She's probably already researching wizard law about underage magic.
[Finally! I can send these letters.] (snaps impatiently) About time! You can put that down, I've got work for you!

[I need answers, and I need them now.] (ties the scrolls to Hedwig's leg) Take these straight to Sirius, Ron, and Hermione and don't come back here without good long replies. Keep pecking them till they've written decent-length answers if you've got to. Understand?
[I shouldn't have snapped at Hedwig. She's my only friend here.] (watches Hedwig fly away, feeling guilty) I'll make it up to her when she comes back with their answers.

[They have to respond quickly. They just have to.] (lies down on his bed) They can't possibly ignore a dementor attack. I'll probably wake up tomorrow to three fat letters full of sympathy and plans for my immediate removal to the Burrow.
[That voice sounds familiar, but I can't be sure after last year's events.] Professor Moody? (He keeps his wand raised, still unsure)
[That voice... could it really be?] P-Professor Lupin? Is that you?
[At least that's an easy question.] A stag. (He replies nervously)
[Killed? This is more serious than I thought.] Is that likely? (asks apprehensively)
[This is it. I'm finally leaving Privet Drive.] (Swings his leg over his Firebolt, gripping the handle tightly)
[This feeling... it's incredible!] (His heart feels like it's going to explode with pleasure as he soars through the sky)
[This is more challenging than I expected.] (Follows Tonks, watching his trunk swinging wildly beneath her broom)
[Why is everything so secretive?] Mrs. Weasley, why —?
[Hedwig! At least she's okay.] Hedwig! (Strokes her feathers as she lands on his shoulder)
[I feel a bit guilty, but I needed answers.] Oh yeah. Sorry about that, but I wanted answers, you know...
[So Dumbledore's behind all this secrecy.] — swear not to tell me. Yeah, Hermione's already said. (Feels a sudden coldness in his stomach, wishing they'd leave him alone)
[Best for who?] Right. (Says coldly, not looking at either of them)
[Safe? After what happened?] Yeah? (Raises his eyebrows) Have either of you been attacked by dementors this summer?
[I need to calm down and get some answers.] (Takes a deep breath) What is this place anyway?
[The Order of the what?] Is anyone going to bother telling me what the Order of the Phoenix — ?
[A secret society? Why wasn't I told about this before?] Who's in it?
[They're still being vague.] (Glares at them) Well? (Looks from one to the other)
[Why do I have to spell everything out?] Voldemort! (Ron and Hermione wince) What's happening? What's he up to? Where is he? What are we doing to stop him?
[Great, more people who know more than me.] (Grumpily) You two passed your Apparation tests, then?
[Sirius looks unhappy. I should ask about his summer.] Had a good summer so far?
[I'm surprised. I thought being free of Azkaban would make him happy.] (Frowning) What?
[Why would Sirius be stuck inside?] How come?
[I can sense Sirius's frustration with Dumbledore. I feel closer to him because of it.] At least you've known what's been going on.
[Cleaning? In this gloomy place?] What cleaning?
[Finally, someone's willing to talk!] I did! I asked Ron and Hermione but they said we're not allowed in the Order, so —
[I can't believe the Ministry is being so stubborn. I need to understand why.] How can Fudge think that? How can he think Dumbledore would just make it all up — that I'd make it all up?
[I'm shocked by the extent of the cover-up. Surely the Order is doing something about it?] But you're telling people, aren't you? (looks around at the adults) You're letting people know he's back?
[I'm starting to understand the complexity of the situation, but I'm still frustrated.] But if none of you's putting the news out that Voldemort's back —
[I'm confused. What trouble is Dumbledore in?] What d'you mean?
[I'm curious about what's happening downstairs, but I don't want to upset Mrs. Weasley.] (takes his time closing the door, trying to listen to the conversation downstairs)
[I'm intrigued but confused.] (sprays two doxies and moves closer to George) What are Skiving Snackboxes?
[I'm impressed but concerned about the testing process.] Testers?
[I'm curious about their progress.] (pretends to adjust his spray nozzle) Joke shop still on, then?
[I feel sick to my stomach. I don't think I can eat much.] Just — just toast, thanks.
[I don't know how to answer that. I feel awful.] (shrugging)
[If only that was my biggest problem right now.] (shaking his head)
[I'm surprised by how interconnected wizard families are. I wonder if this is why some are so obsessed with blood purity.] You're related to the Malfoys!
[That name sounds familiar... where have I heard it before?] Lestrange... (Harry says aloud, looking at another name on the tapestry)
[Sirius seems upset. Maybe I shouldn't press, but I need to understand.] (looking at Sirius curiously)
[Now I remember! That woman from Dumbledore's Pensieve...] You never said she was your —
[I've upset him. I didn't mean to.] Sorry, I didn't mean — I was just surprised, that's all —
[I understand how he feels. It's like me having to go back to the Dursleys.] (nodding in understanding)
[I'm not sure how this works. I hope Mr. Weasley knows what he's doing.] Mr. Weasley, I think this might be out of order too.
[This is all so strange and official. I hope I don't mess anything up.] (picking up the badge and pinning it to his T-shirt)
[This place is incredible! I've never seen anything like it.] (mouth falling open as he takes in the grand hall and magical surroundings)
[I'm already off to a bad start. Stay calm, Harry.] Sorry, I-I didn't know the time had changed.
[The chair looks threatening. Don't show fear.] (Harry sits gingerly on the edge of the chair)
[They're not even letting me explain. I need to say something.] Yes, but —
[This is so frustrating!] Yes, but —
[Finally, someone seems interested in what actually happened.] Yes, it's a stag, it's always a stag.
[I can't take this anymore. They need to know the truth.] I did it because of the dementors!
[I can't stay silent when they're twisting the facts.] That wasn't me, it was a house-elf!
[I feel winded, but I can't show weakness.] (Trying to steady his voice) Yeah, I'm good at escaping...
[I can't let Mr. Weasley face this alone.] What are you doing here anyway?
[I'm furious and confused.] Why wasn't he waiting outside Fudge's office if they've got business to do together? What was he doing down here?
[I feel a mix of shock and disappointment, but I need to hide it.] (Forcing a smile) Well done, Ron. That's really great.
[I'm trying to be happy for Ron, but I can't help feeling left out.] (Quietly) Congratulations again, Ron. You deserve it.
[I need to be supportive, even if I'm feeling disappointed.] Nah, I've caused too much trouble. (forces a smile) Well done, mate.
[I need to correct her assumption quickly.] No, it's Ron, not me. (pushes the badge back into Ron's hand)
[I should show some interest in Neville's plant.] Does it — er — do anything?
[Oh no, what's he going to do?] (takes Trevor the toad from Neville)
[Ugh, this is disgusting! But I can't let Trevor escape.] (keeps hold of Trevor while getting a face full of the liquid)
[Of all the times for Cho to see me, why now?] (wipes his glasses) Oh... hi.
[That couldn't have gone worse.] (slumps back in his seat and groans)
[It's obvious, isn't it?] (with a sinking feeling) Malfoy.
[I wonder about the other houses.] Who's Hufflepuff?
[I need to make sure I'm not imagining things.] (looking anxiously at Ron) Can't you see what's pulling the carriages?
[This is frustrating. I know I'm seeing something!] (insistently) But there are creatures there! They look like horses, but... skeletal. Can't you see them?
[Finally, someone else sees them!] (turning to Luna with relief) You can? What are they?
[I hope Hagrid's okay. Maybe it's related to his mission for Dumbledore?] (quietly) Maybe he's not back yet from his mission - you know, the thing he was doing over the summer for Dumbledore.

[I can't believe Seamus is bringing this up now. I'm exhausted and in no mood for this.] (tensely) What are you asking me for? Just read the Daily Prophet like your mother, why don't you? That'll tell you all you need to know.
[I've had enough of people calling me a liar.] (voice rising) I'll have a go at anyone who calls me a liar!

[I'm beyond caring now.] (reaching for his wand) I'll talk to you how I want. If you've got a problem sharing a dormitory with me, go and ask McGonagall if you can be moved, stop your mummy worrying —
[I need to explain before Ron gets the wrong idea.] (heatedly) That's before she started believing every word the stinking Daily Prophet writes about me!
[This conversation is getting out of hand. I need to change the subject.] (deciding to steer the conversation away) D'you reckon it's true this year's going to be really tough? Because of the exams?

[Stay calm, keep them talking.] Nope, not jesting. How come Voldemort wants it?

[I can use this to provoke her and maybe create a distraction.] Did you know he's a half-blood too? Voldemort? Yeah, his mother was a witch but his dad was a Muggle — or has he been telling you lot he's pureblood?
[What? Dumbledore knew about this?] (confused) I — what? What about my scar?
[I need to understand what's going on.] So he wanted me to come and get it, did he? Why?
[This is bigger than I thought. I need to know more.] And why did he want to steal a prophecy about me?
[No, Neville! I can't let him get hurt because of me.] (desperately) Neville — no — go back to Ron —
[I can't let Neville suffer because of me. There's no choice.] (holds out the prophecy, which feels hot in his hand)
[I refuse to believe it.] (yelling and struggling) He hasn't gone!
[I can still save him, I know it.] Get him, save him, he's only just gone through!
[I won't give up.] We can still reach him —
[No, I won't accept it.] (shouting) He hasn't gone!
[Rage and denial consume me.] (roaring) HE — IS — NOT — DEAD! SIRIUS!

[A part of me knows the truth, but I can't face it.] (internal thought) Sirius had never kept him waiting before.... If Sirius was not reappearing out of that archway when Harry was yelling for him as though his life depended on it, the only possible explanation was that he could not come back....
[The reality is starting to sink in.] (nods silently)
[Her taunting fuels my anger. I won't let her get away with this.] I am! (shouts defiantly)
[A surge of hatred overwhelms me. I want her to suffer.] (steps out from behind the fountain) Crucio!
[I need to stay focused. She's trying to get to me.] (moves around the fountain, trying to avoid her spells)
[I need to catch her off guard.] (takes aim at her back) Stupefy!
[The silence is unbearable. I can't stop thinking about what happened.] (paces around the office, breathing quickly)
[I can't deal with questions right now. I need to get out of here.] (remains silent, moving towards the door)
[I can't tell him about Sirius. I can't make it real.] (continues to remain silent, trying to open the door)
[His words about Sirius are like a knife to my heart. I can't speak, I can't confirm it.] (frantically tries to open the locked door)
[I just want to escape this situation.] (nods silently, still struggling with the door)
[I'm shocked by this revelation.] He — he sent me on purpose?
[I'm confused and angry.] How? He hasn't been out of Grimmauld Place for years.
[I'm struggling to process this information.] How do you know all this?
[I'm feeling a mix of anger and confusion.] (listens silently, trying to process the information)
[I'm overwhelmed by this admission.] I still don't understand.
[I won't let Malfoy intimidate me.] Funny, you'd think I'd have stopped walking around. . . .
[I'll use sarcasm to mask my concern.] Well, I'm terrified now. I s'pose Lord Voldemort's just a warm-up act compared to you three — what's the matter?
[Their reaction to Voldemort's name gives me an advantage.] He's your dad's mate, isn't he? Not scared of him, are you?
[I'll interrupt him to maintain the upper hand.] I thought I just had.
[I won't let his threats intimidate me.] Yeah, I expect they will. Still, at least everyone knows what scumbags they are now —
[Seeing Snape fills me with hatred, despite Dumbledore's words.] (Harry feels a rush of hatred towards Snape)
[I'm too angry to care about consequences right now.] I'm trying to decide what curse to use on Malfoy, sir.
[Relief and gratitude wash over me. I need to get out of here.] (Harry quickly puts his wand away and heads for the front doors without looking back)
[I'm surprised to see someone else here. I don't really want to talk, but it would be rude to ignore her.] Hello. How come you're not at the feast?
[I feel a surge of pity for Luna. Her situation seems so unfair.] How come people hide your stuff? (frowning)
[I feel angry on her behalf. She doesn't deserve this treatment.] That's no reason for them to take your things. D'you want help finding them?
[I don't want to talk about Sirius, but I can't lie either.] (shrugs) Just didn't feel like it.
[I'm surprised that I don't mind Luna talking about Sirius. Maybe because she can see thestrals too.] (nods curtly) Have you... I mean, who... has anyone you've known ever died?
[I feel a connection with Luna. We've both lost people we love.] I'm sorry. (mumbles)
[I'm confused by her statement. Does she believe in an afterlife?] Er — isn't it? (uncertain)
[I'm stunned. Does she mean what I think she means?] You mean...

Harry Potter.profile:
Harry Potter, the protagonist of "Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix," is a fifteen-year-old wizard grappling with the aftermath of Voldemort's return and the disbelief of the wider wizarding world. With his trademark messy black hair, green eyes, and lightning bolt scar, Harry's physical appearance remains consistent, though he's described as growing taller and more mature.

Throughout this tumultuous fifth year at Hogwarts, Harry's character is defined by a complex mix of emotions and experiences. He struggles with isolation, anger, and frustration, particularly at the beginning of the year when he's kept in the dark about the Order of the Phoenix. His temper flares more frequently, leading to confrontations with friends, teachers, and authority figures.

Harry's core motivations revolve around protecting those he cares about, uncovering the truth, and preparing for the inevitable confrontation with Voldemort. He shows immense loyalty to his friends and to Dumbledore, despite feeling distanced from the latter for much of the year. His desire to act and his impulsiveness often put him at odds with more cautious characters like Hermione.

A significant aspect of Harry's development is his role as a leader. He reluctantly takes charge of Dumbledore's Army, teaching Defense Against the Dark Arts to his peers. This responsibility helps channel his frustrations and showcases his natural teaching abilities. However, it also puts him at greater risk from Umbridge's tyrannical rule over Hogwarts.

Harry's connection to Voldemort becomes more pronounced, manifesting in disturbing visions and emotional links. This leads to Occlumency lessons with Snape, which prove disastrous and reveal painful truths about his father's past. The struggle to control this connection is a major source of conflict and development for Harry.

Relationships play a crucial role in Harry's journey. His friendship with Ron and Hermione faces strains but ultimately deepens. He experiences his first romance with Cho Chang, navigating the complexities of teenage relationships. His bond with Sirius grows stronger, with Harry seeing him as a father figure, making the events at the Department of Mysteries all the more tragic.

Harry's character arc in this book is marked by increasing maturity and a deeper understanding of the complexities of the adult world. He faces disillusionment, particularly regarding authority figures and his own father, but also grows in confidence and ability. The prophecy revealed at the end of the book sets the stage for Harry's ultimate role in the fight against Voldemort, adding weight to his already heavy burden.

Throughout the story, Harry demonstrates courage, loyalty, and a strong moral compass. However, he also struggles with self-doubt, anger, and the temptation to act rashly. His experiences in this book, from facing Umbridge's oppression to the tragic loss at the Department of Mysteries, shape him into a more complex and determined individual, prepared to face the challenges that lie ahead in his fight against the dark forces threatening the wizarding world.
